lender.name: Michael

lender.name: Dan
lender.loan_because: Through small loans we have the ability to improve other peoples lives.
lender.occupational_info: As the water resource specialist in Teton County Wyoming I work with people and organizations to protect and enhance our valuable water resources.

lender.name: michael

lender.occupational_info: I play music.

lender.name: Cherie

lender.name: Omar
lender.loan_because: I know from first hand how hard is to live in need, now i do understand and believe a few dollars can change at least one life forever.
lender.occupational_info: I do just enough to support my my family, and i have enough to help others

lender.name: Kelsey
lender.loan_because: It is amazing how far a dollar can go.

lender.name: Haldun
lender.loan_because: Happiness is a positive feedback system with a high action potential.
lender.occupational_info: Design consulting for technology start-ups.

lender.name: Kate & Dave
lender.loan_because: We've been lucky to have generous support as we forge our own paths. We value hard work, independence, perseverance and dreams. We wanted to do our little bit to help expand opportunities for people who are trying to make their own way, because we're still trying, too.
lender.occupational_info: Kate is a newspaper editor and writer, Dave manages a cafe. We're both artists, and we sell our work locally to supplement our income.

lender.name: Lisa & Mike
lender.loan_because: We've been inspired by our son, Michael, who formed this Kiva team!

lender.name: Laurel

lender.occupational_info: I work with kids in area hospitals to keep up their school studies and their morale. With a maze, a puzzle or a discussion on dinosaurs, it keeps them stimulated and gives them something to think about besides their next therapy or treatment.

lender.occupational_info: I teach glassblowing in Chicago

lender.name: Heidi
lender.loan_because: I feel it's a wonderful way to share with business owners who might have no other way to raise capital. Helping small businesses prevents poverty, disease, war, domestic violence and more. How great that a small donation can have such a powerful impact.
lender.occupational_info: I've owned a number of different businesses. I'm 36 years old, a Mom of three children and happily married. I try to run businesses that help the health of our planet.

lender.occupational_info: I chisel, plane, saw, cut, glue, nail, sand boards, planks and other wooden material - to make cupboards, beds, tables, chairs.

lender.loan_because:
At university, I studied education in developing countries as a module for my degree, and was shocked by what I learnt.
As soon as our company gave us the chance to help people, I just had to sign up - I am really pleased to be able to help people, and I intend on donating money to groups looking for academic assistance to improve their situation.

lender.name: Paula
lender.loan_because: I want the world economy to be more fair, and I'd like to participate in creating feasible business opportunities for women in developing countries. lender.name: Sheyanne

lender.name: Mayuri
lender.loan_because: Microfinance has the ability to change lives and lift people out of poverty and hunger. It's not a donation or a hand-out but utilizes the skills of talented individuals and provides a sustainable method of improving the community.
lender.occupational_info:
This quote by Mahatma Gandhi continues to inspire me: "I shall pass through this world but once. Any good therefore that I can do or any kindness that I can show to any human being, let me do it now. Let me not defer or neglect it, for I shall not pass this way again."
I am going to be a pediatrician and plan on working in underserved communities.

lender.name: Jon
lender.loan_because: I want to help people outside of my community. I feel called to do this and blessed that I am able to.

lender.name: Iyer

lender.name: Derek

lender.name: Juana
lender.loan_because: I know that right now the economy here in the states is suffering, and some people are losing their jobs or their businesses are not succeeding. I thought that this would be a way to help those who are trying to support their families and help out their communities by forming their own small businesses. I believe that we should help out those who are just starting out and need help during this time.
lender.occupational_info: right now I'm a student and it takes a lot of guts to put in all your energy into your studies.... you have to read a lot, study, but you would also have to balance your time with friends

lender.name: Jose
lender.loan_because: I believe in helping anyone willing to help themselves. Initiative is the greatest human gift.

lender.name: chris
lender.loan_because:
My father and grandfather were christian baptist ministers and even as a non-religious person i respect the idea of tithing. I feel i need to give about 5-10% of my earnings to better my community.
i understand that my community includes the rest of the world. So the 5-10% will go not just to local shelters, food banks, etc, but also to places like kiva and unicef.
Though, i like kiva, i am not happy that my capital is loaned with interest, and i receive no interest back. I'd rather there be no interest, but since there is, if part was returned to me, i could loan out that much more....
lender.occupational_info: I solve complex system problems (normally business in nature) using technology such as computer software and computer hardware.

lender.name: Hakayati
lender.loan_because: I believe in micro-financing as a strategy to oppose poverty.

lender.loan_because: I'm lucky enough to be able to

lender.name: Armenian Center
lender.loan_because: The Center is founded on the ideals of sound business principles and practices to promote economic freedom for people in poverty.
lender.occupational_info: The Armenian Center for International Development exists to apply life-affirming business principles to the complex challenges of global poverty. The Center for International Development places a particular focus on areas of economic and social development.
